result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy Allen Muns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge on count one only.
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments and costs.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds and as a condition of Extended supervision.  To be paid by end of supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two. Credit for 166 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain employment, work at least 30 hours per week.
Participate in educational, vocational, training while incarcerated and during Extended supervision.
Obtain mental health evaluation. Complete follow up care/treatment.
No contact with victims Airene T., Leona M, and the Dunkin Donuts located at 622 W. Wisconsin Ave.
Obtain AODA assessment-AODA program completed at HOC may satisfy if deemed approrpiate by DOC.  Complete followup care/treatment.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms; may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.
$1,128.67 payable to State of Wisconsin Crime Victim Compensation Program.  To be paid first.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one. Credit for 166 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy Allen Muns

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING Transcript (25 pages) commencing 09/14/15 received and filed.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to Drug Abuse Correctional Center Attn. Stephanie P.O.Box 36 Winnebago, wi 54985
Signed and Filed: Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order- ERP
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 7, Judge MCADAMS. ew
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Filed:  Letter from Department of Justice Crime Victim Compensation Program.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Troy Allen Muns not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. State advised the Court she will not be filing additional charges in this matter. Court ordered this matter be set for sentencing. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Troy Allen Muns not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another date after the State's intake and prelim week; State to issue new charges.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Finding[s] and Order with Respect to HIV Testing, signed and filed.  Copies returned to ADA Schroeder.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Troy Allen Muns in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Troy Allen Muns in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case recalled.  Defense counsel advised the Court that her client wishes to proceed with a plea on today's date.  Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty of Counts 1 and 2 as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Troy Allen Muns not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived her client's appearance. For reasons stated on the record,  parties requsted a short adjournment.  Court granted same.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Wineke contacted the court and indicated she was in trial and unable to appear on tomorrow; requested another date.  Case is rescheduled for plea and sentencing before Branch 20 on 6/26/15 at 8:30 a.m.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Same bail.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Troy Allen Muns not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared on behalf of Sara Schroeder for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Troy Allen Muns not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Wineke indicated she had a scheduling conflict and requested a short adjournment.  The 4/23/15 date is vacated.  File retained in court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Troy Allen Muns in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Troy Allen Muns in custody.  James Frisch for  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jonathan Echevarria-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: L Merril;  A.Tiodin;  Dunkin Donuts.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Troy Allen Muns in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  
Defendant Troy Allen Muns in custody.  
Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has not been obtained and orders the Sheriff Department to collect the DNA sample from the Defendant
Court advised Defendant  he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
